org.deidentifier.arx.masking

Interface IDictionaryMasker<T>

  • Type Parameters:
    T - The type of data to be masked.
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractDictionaryMasker, AbstractInstBasedDictMasker, AbstractReplaceInstMasker, ConstantShiftDateMasker, ConstantShiftDecimalMasker, GenerateRandomDateMasker, GenerateRandomDecimalMasker, GenerateRandomIntegerDecimalMasker, GenerateRandomStringMasker, MatchAndReplaceStringMasker, RandomShiftDateMasker, RandomShiftDecimalMasker, ReplaceDictMasker, ReplaceDictMasker.ReplaceDateDictMasker, ReplaceDictMasker.ReplaceDecimalDictMasker, ReplaceDictMasker.ReplaceStringDictMasker, ReplaceInstMasker, ReplaceInstMasker.ReplaceDateInstMasker, ReplaceInstMasker.ReplaceDecimalInstMasker, ReplaceInstMasker.ReplaceStringInstMasker, ShuffleMasker, ShuffleMasker.ShuffleDateMasker, ShuffleMasker.ShuffleDecimalMasker, ShuffleMasker.ShuffleStringMasker, SplitAndReplaceStringMasker

    public interface IDictionaryMasker<T>
    Performs data masking on a whole dictionary of data of type T.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void maskList(java.util.List<T> data)
      Masks the dictionary of data in the input list.

    • Method Detail

      • maskList

        void maskList(java.util.List<T> data)
        Masks the dictionary of data in the input list. The original data is overwritten.
        Parameters:
        data - The list of data on which the masking is performed and to which the masked output is written.
